H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H5287.def: = action by which animals produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H4147.def: = material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6311.def: = a reference to the location of the speaker

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H3213.def: = action by which humans utter a high-pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4998.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2834.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H8389.def: = the shape of (part of) the body of humans and animals; ≈ mostly used in contexts emphasizing the beauty of someone's face and figure

H5137.def: = process by which drops or small quantities of a liquid fall on object

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
